choices.A: Delete entry 6 because this information should be included in Stage or Team Plans.
choices.C: Delete entry 7 because this should be included in the Configuration Management Strategy.
choices.D: Delete entry 8 because the results of quality reviews are recorded in the Quality Register.
choices.B: Move entry 6 to the Reporting section because the information should be used to report on quality activities.

discussion.content: Entry 8 applies to the Records section in Prince2. The statement to delete is "Delete entry 8 because the results of quality reviews are recorded in the Quality Register." This is because entry 8 mentions that approval records for products that require them will be stored in the quality database. However, this conflicts with the fact that the Quality Register will be maintained to record the planned quality events and the actual results from the quality activities, as mentioned in entry 6. Therefore, it would be appropriate to delete entry 8 to avoid duplication of effort and ensure that all relevant quality information is recorded in the Quality Register

questions.question_text: Which statement applies to the Records section?

discussion.content: The Roles and responsibilities section should include the roles and responsibilities of the project team members and stakeholders in relation to quality management. Entry 9 is relevant because it specifies the DIT’s role in ensuring the employment contracts comply with the law. Entry 10 is also relevant because it specifies the Team Managers’ role in providing details of quality checks. Entry 11 is also relevant because it specifies the Team Managers’ role in updating the Quality Register with the names of reviewers. Entry 12 is not relevant because it specifies the Senior User’s role in reviewing the Product Descriptions, which is not a quality management activity. The responsibility of reviewing the Product Descriptions should belong to supplier assurance, which is part of Project Assurance. Therefore, entry 12 should be amended to reflect this.

questions.question_text: Which statement applies to the Roles and responsibilities section?

choices.B: Delete entry 10 because this is the responsibility of the quality review chair.
choices.A: Delete entry 9 because this should only be recorded in the Product Description.
choices.D: Amend entry 12 because this is the responsibility of supplier assurance.
choices.C: Delete entry 11 because only the Project Manager can update the Quality Register.

questions.question_text: Which is a correctly defined acceptance criterion for the transferred facilities computer system?

discussion.content: This criterion is specific (no loss of functionality), measurable (zero loss), and unambiguous in defining what needs to be achieved for the acceptance of the transferred computer system.

choices.A: Must be subject to regular back-ups.
choices.D: Back-up of data must be kept until the data is no longer needed.
choices.B: Planned periods of shutdowns of the computer system must be kept to a minimum.

questions.question_text: Which is a correctly defined acceptance criterion for the transferred staff?

discussion.content:
C. All legal requirements are adhered to for the transfer of staff.

Acceptance criteria should be specific, measurable, and relevant to the project's objectives. Option C meets these criteria by specifying that all legal requirements must be adhered to, which is a clear and measurable condition for accepting the transfer of staff. Options A, B, and D are not specific or measurable enough to serve as effective acceptance criteria in a PRINCE2 project.

choices.D: Retained staff should be of reasonable competence to maintain the SLA.
choices.C: All legal requirements are adhered to for the transfer of staff.
choices.A: No staff are to be left behind.
choices.B: Staff should be transferred as soon as possible.

questions.question_text: Which is a correctly defined acceptance criterion for the running cost of the outsourced service?

choices.B: Must be kept to a level acceptable to the Ministry of Food Hygiene.
choices.D: The annual increase to be less than half the rate of inflation.
choices.A: Must be kept to a minimum.

discussion.content: D. The annual increase to be less than half the rate of inflation.
